definition: dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Can you tell me where it is available?
sentences.chinese: 這種工法怎麼能說是旁門左道呢？

sentences.english: Such Confucianism achievement is what you side heresy in the door can compare?
sentences.chinese: 如此儒家功，豈是你們旁門左道所能比擬的？

sentences.english: Take the company of heterodoxy, final meeting becomes his victim.
sentences.chinese: 走旁門左道的企業，最終會成爲自己的受害者。

definition: to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
